p: For immunofluorescence detection of PCV-2, PK-15 cells were infected with IONzyme-treated or untreated PCV-2 at MOI=0.5 for 24 h. After washing, fixation, saturation, and blocking, the cells were incubated at 37 Â°C for 1 h with using a pig polyclonal antiserum (VMRD, Washington, USA) 58, followed by incubation with FITC-conjugated rabbit anti-pig antibody (Southern Biotech, Birmingham, USA). The cells were washed and examined under a fluorescence microscope. Cells positive for PCV-2 viral antigens were counted in six fields of view.
